metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11720 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Some unicode characters are incorrectly treated as whitespace during the parsing of web content instead of triggering parsing errors. This allows malicious code to then be processed, evading cross-site scripting (XSS) filtering. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 68.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
